2024-12-15.content: Been thinking about how we optimize for metrics that don't actually matter. Revenue per user, engagement time, conversion rates. But what about the stuff that makes people feel more human after using your product? That's unmeasurable and therefore ignored.

2024-12-14.content: Had coffee with someone who said they 'don't have time to read.' But they spent 3 hours on TikTok yesterday. It's not about time, it's about what kind of thinking we've trained ourselves to expect. We want ideas that hit immediately, not ones that unfold slowly.

2024-12-13.content: Everyone talks about work-life balance but maybe the real problem is that we've made work so meaningless that we need an entire separate 'life' to compensate. What if work itself could be life-giving?

2024-12-12.content: The best conversations happen when both people are slightly confused. When you're both reaching for ideas that don't quite exist yet. Clarity is overrated.

2024-12-11.content: Noticed I check my phone within 30 seconds of any minor discomfort. Boredom, awkwardness, waiting in line. We've eliminated all the small gaps where thoughts used to live.

2024-12-10.content: Built something today that felt genuinely useful. Not optimized for engagement or retention or any of that shit. Just useful. Forgot how good that feels.

2024-12-09.content: Why do we call it 'consuming' content? You don't consume a conversation or consume a walk in the park. Language shapes how we think about these things more than we realize.

2024-12-08.content: Met someone who prints out articles to read them. Thought that was weird until I tried it. Something about the physical constraint changes how you think. No tabs to click, no rabbit holes. Just you and the idea.
